page.title: 01The Guyzance Area.
page.content: The area covered by the survey is situated in mid Northumberland,between the A1 Trunk Road and the main East Coast Railway.People have settled in the area for at least four thousand years and today farm names still reflect their Angle and Norman origins. The area is prime agricultural land and most of the buildings are associated with the various farms.The only communities,other than farms,are Guyzance and a recent development on the Warkworth boundary to the north-east.There is only one other industry within the area,the extraction of water from the River Coquet at Warkworth.
